body.p:
My friend rev P Moses has informed me
that you have sent to him amongst other accounts a charge
of $12 against me for the “Occident” I certainly was not
aware that I was so much indebted for the publication as
I thought & full believed I had paid my brother about two years
ago for it. However I enclose herewith $5 on a
c & will
endeavour to liquidate the balance soon Circumstances
compel me unwillingly to decline receiving your paper
for the present at any rate, or until I have paid up my
deficiency, I regret the necessity but having embraced a new
life, & being at present not settled in occupation, with an in
creasing family, I feel the necessity of debaving? myself of
this as well as other luxuries you will appreciate my mo
-tives.When Mr Gutheim left this city, I under
took the study of the law in his place; and being with one of the first
practicioners in the city, & the only one of our creed in the pro
fession in this state, with 3500 coreligionists in this city,
and a practical knowledge of business & commercial affairs gen
erally, I flatter myself that I shall succeed eventually. Mr
Moses asked me to act as your agent but I think him very
capable and efficient & being disengaged the best one you can
procure. I am engaged closely at my studies & could not
well attend to the matter but any service I can render, you
may command me.

We had a very
heartrending occurence here among us, an infant son of
M Miochring? on return from School went by the fire his

clothes caught & in a few moments the devouring element
encased him & his spirit fled to his God: the Father is in one
of the Southern states & will not know his bereavement 'till
he arrives home full of hope & joy to greet his wife & little ones

We are endeavouring to erect a
new edifice for the congregation of which I am secy
the Kahl A Kodesh Beni Israel we have purchased the
ground adjoining our present synagogue & our lot is
worth $20,000 which you will see is a vast sum to raise
for the purpose, now we have to raise the means of
building, an appeal will be made to our brethren thro'
the states as soon as our plans are fully matured, we
propose to begin this spring & require $25,000 to finish
the building, schools, &c to be attached the edifice to be
90 feet square. It is absolutely necessary for us to build
to accommodate the increased & increasing multitude around
us, tho' we find much difficulty in our proposed object.
our form is the German ritual we require much a com
petent (we have one who we cannot well be rid of
he answered very well 15 years back when he got $100
per annum but the progress of the age & the progress
of our congregation calls for another and a better man
he is an incumbus we ought to be rid of but having
a family of 6 or 7 children, sympathy tends many persons
to retain him—the other congregation Revd H A Henry as pastor
progresses well also.— When do you intend visiting the event?
With best regards I am yours
